answerText: The Mower to the Glow-Worms [10] This metaphysical poet and author of the "Mower" poems also penned the line "Had we but world enough and time" in his poem "To His Coy Mistress."
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Wellesley + Hunter  | 7 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: The speaker of this poem states "I shall never find my home" because Juliana "my mind hath so displac'd."  For 10 points: [10] Name this poem addressed to some creatures with "officious flame" that are called "ye living lamps."
